author: Special Correspondent
text:
A hunger fast by members of the Tamil Nadu Contract Government Welfare Association, was called off on Saturday.

The nurses had been striking since Thursday morning at the Directorate of Medical Services, demanding regularisation of their services.

On Saturday, a meeting of the nurses with Health Minister C. Vijaya Baskar, Health Secretary J. Radhakrishnan, and other senior government officials was held, following which the strike was called off. On Friday, the Chief Minister had announced in the Assembly that the services of 1,500 contract nurses would be regularised.

“We were assured that the regularisation of the remaining 1,452 nurses would take place as soon as possible,” said R. Sindhan, State joint secretary of the Association.

A government official said the nurses would be regularised as and when new posts came up at new hospitals. “The ESI Hospital, the Pudukottai medical college and primary health centres are coming up, so it will happen,” he said.
title: Contract nurses call off fast after govt. assurance
